etymology.description: 金(金) (jīn, "metal") + 昔(昔) (xī, "past") = grindstone -> incorrect positioning of elements -> mistake
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the metal radical 金(金) (jīn, "metal") with the phonetic element 昔(昔) (xī, "past") to represent the notion of a grindstone, which is used visually to symbolize misalignment or error, leading to the meaning of 'wrong' or 'mistake.'
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 錯(錯) (cuò, "wrong")'s 釒(金) (jīn, "metal") with 钅, a cursive variant.

examples.chinese: 你的答案错了(你的答案錯了)。
他虽然努力了(他雖然努力了)，结果终究错了(結果終究錯了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā suīrán nǔlì le, jiéguǒ zhōngjiū cuò le.
examples.english: Although he tried hard, he ultimately made a mistake.

examples.chinese: 犯错是学习的一部分(犯錯是學習的一部分)。
examples.pinyin: Fàn cuò shì xuéxí de yībùfèn.
examples.english: Making mistakes is a part of learning.
